level_of_care_scale.1: Independent, no assistance needed, uses equipment appropriately, no special needs.
level_of_care_scale.2: Verbal prompts and cues only needed to complete care or to use equipment appropriately.
level_of_care_scale.3: Physical assistance from caregiver needed to accomplish care and may need verbal cues to use equipment appropriately.
level_of_care_scale.4: Dependent on caregiver to accomplish care.

checkboxes.label: Prepare, serve and clean up 3 meals a day
Provide snacks as requested.
Provide clothing protectors if needed.
Cue and encourage resident to eat.
Cut up foods, butter bread, set-up plate.
Observe and assist for aspiration risk
Feed resident PRN.
Serve appropriate-size portions.
Monitor and record dietary intake.
Observe special diet requirements per doctor's order.
Avoid foods that cause allergic or adverse reactions.
Provide adequate fluids every two hours during the day.
Allow food preferences when possible.
Weigh monthly (if possible)
Provide adequate setting for meals.
Provide meals in room - PRN
Add thickeners to food PRN MD orders.
Provide 5 servings of fruits /vegetables daily.

fields.label: Describe how caregivers should assist resident
fields.value: Make sure she is upright position when eating and remain upright positions for 45 minutes to 1 hour after eating to prevent aspiration.

checkboxes.label: Remind to resident to use toilet every two hours
Assist to the toilet as needed.
Wash resident's hands after they use the toilet
Remind resident to wash hands after toilet use
Provide washcloth for cleanliness after they use the toilet.
Assist with clothing on and off as needed to toilet.
Clean perineal area twice daily, after bowel movement and as needed
Change briefs as needed
Change urinary pads every 2-3 hours and as needed
Set up, empty and clean bedside commode.
Set up, empty and clean urinal.
Set up, empty and clean bedpan.
Apply condom catheter and clean reservoir bag daily.
Provide privacy for resident while toileting.
Monitor urine for clarity, odor and color
Document and report abnormal urine.
Monitor stool for consistency and regularity.
Document and report abnormal or irregular stool.
Limit fluids after 6:00 PM to decrease nightly urination.
